fields.description:
When testing failover of HA Walrus in EUCA-5031, the CCs exhibited the following behavior:

* while the database syncing was occurring, the CCs had the state of DISABLED
* after the database finished syncing, CC02 flipped back and forth from DISABLED to ENABLED.  This behavior happened for about 5 minutes, then it stayed in the ENABLED state. Example below:

{code}
SERVICE  cluster        	cluster01      	cc01           	DISABLED  	241 	http://192.68.105.12:8774/axis2/services/EucalyptusCC	arn:euca:eucalyptus:cluster01:cluster:cc01/
SERVICE	cluster        	cluster01      	cc02           	DISABLED  	241 	http://192.68.105.13:8774/axis2/services/EucalyptusCC	arn:euca:eucalyptus:cluster01:cluster:cc02/
SERVICE	eucalyptus     	eucalyptus     	192.68.105.10  	ENABLED   	241 	http://192.68.105.10:8773/services/Eucalyptus	arn:euca:eucalyptus:::192.68.105.10/
SERVICE	eucalyptus     	eucalyptus     	192.68.105.11  	DISABLED  	241 	http://192.68.105.11:8773/services/Eucalyptus	arn:euca:eucalyptus:::192.68.105.11/
SERVICE	storage        	cluster01      	sc01           	ENABLED   	241 	http://192.68.105.12:8773/services/Storage	arn:euca:eucalyptus:cluster01:storage:sc01/
SERVICE	bootstrap      	bootstrap      	192.68.105.10  	ENABLED   	241 	http://192.68.105.10:8773/services/Empyrean	arn:euca:bootstrap:::192.68.105.10/
SERVICE	dns            	eucalyptus     	192.68.105.10  	ENABLED   	241 	http://192.68.105.10:8773/services/Dns  	arn:euca:eucalyptus::dns:192.68.105.10/
SERVICE	walrus         	walrus         	walrus01       	ENABLED   	241 	http://192.68.105.10:8773/services/Walrus	arn:euca:bootstrap:walrus:walrus:walrus01/
SERVICE	walrus         	walrus         	walrus02       	DISABLED  	241 	http://192.68.105.11:8773/services/Walrus	arn:euca:bootstrap:walrus:walrus:walrus02/
{code}

After few seconds we do this again and now one of the CC is ENABLED

{code}
euca-describe-services 
SERVICE	cluster        	cluster01      	cc01           	DISABLED  	242 	http://192.68.105.12:8774/axis2/services/EucalyptusCC	arn:euca:eucalyptus:cluster01:cluster:cc01/
SERVICE	cluster        	cluster01      	cc02           	ENABLED   	242 	http://192.68.105.13:8774/axis2/services/EucalyptusCC	arn:euca:eucalyptus:cluster01:cluster:cc02/
SERVICE	eucalyptus     	eucalyptus     	192.68.105.10  	ENABLED   	242 	http://192.68.105.10:8773/services/Eucalyptus	arn:euca:eucalyptus:::192.68.105.10/
SERVICE	eucalyptus     	eucalyptus     	192.68.105.11  	DISABLED  	242 	http://192.68.105.11:8773/services/Eucalyptus	arn:euca:eucalyptus:::192.68.105.11/
SERVICE	storage        	cluster01      	sc01           	ENABLED   	242 	http://192.68.105.12:8773/services/Storage	arn:euca:eucalyptus:cluster01:storage:sc01/
SERVICE	bootstrap      	bootstrap      	192.68.105.10  	ENABLED   	242 	http://192.68.105.10:8773/services/Empyrean	arn:euca:bootstrap:::192.68.105.10/
SERVICE	dns            	eucalyptus     	192.68.105.10  	ENABLED   	242 	http://192.68.105.10:8773/services/Dns  	arn:euca:eucalyptus::dns:192.68.105.10/
SERVICE	walrus         	walrus         	walrus01       	ENABLED   	242 	http://192.68.105.10:8773/services/Walrus	arn:euca:bootstrap:walrus:walrus:walrus01/
SERVICE	walrus         	walrus         	walrus02       	DISABLED  	242 	http://192.68.105.11:8773/services/Walrus	arn:euca:bootstrap:walrus:walrus:walrus02/
{code}


When checking the logs in the Primary CLC regarding state transition of the CCs, the following error was seen:

{code}
Tue Feb 19 09:36:10 2013 ERROR [Topology:Eucalyptus.bootstrap:EphemeralConfiguration:arn:euca:bootstrap:Topology::external/.class java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker#4] [com.eucalyptus.component.Topology$TopologyChange.doTopologyChange(Topology.java):1166] ENABLE:ENABLED  arn:euca:eucalyptus:cluster01:cluster:cc01/ DISABLED->ENABLED=NOTREADY [No active databases in cluster eucalyptus_general]
Tue Feb 19 09:39:54 2013 ERROR [Topology:Eucalyptus.bootstrap:EphemeralConfiguration:arn:euca:bootstrap:Topology::external/.class java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker#6] [com.eucalyptus.component.Topology$TopologyChange.doTopologyChange(Topology.java):1166] ENABLE:ENABLED  arn:euca:eucalyptus:cluster01:cluster:cc02/ DISABLED->ENABLED=NOTREADY [No active databases in cluster eucalyptus_general]
{code}

The cloud is now stable, but we want to know why this behavior occurred after failover of CLC, Walrus was initiated by stopping/starting eucalyptus-cloud process.
fields.summary: HA CC state flip-flop from ENABLED to DISABLED to ENABLED
fields.environment:
*HA*

CLC/Walrus - Machine 1 - Primary
CLC/Walrus - Machine 2 - Secondary
CC/SC - Machine 3 - Primary
CC - Machine 4 - Secondary
NC - Machine 5,6

comments.body: Since the epoch # only went up by 1, the CC failover took 5 minutes.  Its possible to have the CC failover because the CLC is failing over and the CC health check was failing to occur within the 2 minute default time limit.

Hi [~decker] , 

You requested for some more logs on IRC, I have attached those to the linked escalation ticket, please let me know if you want any further information.

We have access to the machines, if you wish to look into the system.

= Time Interval =
Time period of interest is indicated, in part, by the epoch numbers in the reported euca-describe-services output; epochs 241 and 242.

Additionally, we can see that the CC is receiving DisableService requests during the following time period.

*From {{cc02}}'s log file:*
{code}
2013-02-19 09:24:54  INFO | disabling service
# ... 10 other occurrences every 1 min +/- 10 seconds
2013-02-19 09:36:12  INFO | disabling service
{code}

The flopping time period is then, at longest, *09:24:54 - 09:36:12*.

Subsequently, the time between *09:36:12 - 09:40:50* has the CC {{cc02}} in ENABLED but not working yet, possibly causing more state transitions (though not indicated by an explicit call to DisableService on the CC).

*From {{cc02}}'s log file:*
{code}
2013-02-19 09:36:12  INFO | disabling service
2013-02-19 09:36:14  WARN | cloudIp is not yet set, not installing redirect rule
# ... during this interval the CC cc02 is ENABLED but not working yet.
2013-02-19 09:40:50  INFO | instances: 0011 (0011 extant + 0000 pending + 0000 terminated)
{code}

= Timeline =

* 09:23:54 CLC on 128.84.105.11 shutdown/parted.
* 09:36:12 CLC on 128.84.105.11 started/rejoins.
* 09:39:51 Last occurrence of epoch #240 (demarcates beginning of period reported above).
* 09:39:53 CLC on 128.84.105.11 has synchronized w/ system state.
* 09:40:31 Last occurrence of epoch #241 (during which {{cc02}} was at least once reported as {{DISABLED}}).
* 09:41:32 First occurence of epoch #242 (demarcates end of period of interest; {{cc02}} has become {{ENABLED}} before this time).

From this it follows that between *09:36:12* and *09:40:31* there may have been failures occurring on {{128.84.105.10}} related to state handling for {{cc02}} which would illuminate the underlying cause.

= Possibly Related =
It seems there is something "unusual" happening with database connections that roots in a fault occurring inside the JDK.  Looking at logs for 128.84.105.10 may better indicate whether there is a systemic impact.
{code}
2013-02-19 09:44:00  WARN | Database 128.84.105.11 from cluster eucalyptus_storage is not responding.
org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: Something unusual has occured to cause the driver to fail. Please report this exception.
      at org.postgresql.Driver.connect(Driver.java:287)
      at net.sf.hajdbc.sql.DriverDatabase.connect(DriverDatabase.java:127)
      at net.sf.hajdbc.sql.DriverDatabase.connect(DriverDatabase.java:40)
      at net.sf.hajdbc.sql.AbstractDatabaseCluster.test(AbstractDatabaseCluster.java:248)
      at net.sf.hajdbc.sql.AbstractDatabaseCluster.isAlive(AbstractDatabaseCluster.java:230)
      at net.sf.hajdbc.sql.AbstractDatabaseCluster$2.call(AbstractDatabaseCluster.java:192)
      at net.sf.hajdbc.sql.AbstractDatabaseCluster$2.call(AbstractDatabaseCluster.java:189)
      at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerRun(FutureTask.java:334)
      at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:166)
      at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1110)
      at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:603)
      at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:679)
Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
      at sun.security.ssl.JsseJce.isEcAvailable(JsseJce.java:183)
      at sun.security.ssl.CipherSuite$KeyExchange.isAvailable(CipherSuite.java:297)
      at sun.security.ssl.CipherSuite.isAvailable(CipherSuite.java:162)
      at sun.security.ssl.CipherSuiteList.<init>(CipherSuiteList.java:87)
      at sun.security.ssl.SSLSocketImpl.setEnabledCipherSuites(SSLSocketImpl.java:2101)
      at com.eucalyptus.postgresql.PostgreSQLSSLSocketFactory.notifyCreated(PostgreSQLSSLSocketFactory.java:109)
      at com.eucalyptus.net.SSLSocketFactoryWrapper.createSocket(SSLSocketFactoryWrapper.java:97)
      at org.postgresql.ssl.MakeSSL.convert(MakeSSL.java:63)
      at org.postgresql.core.v3.ConnectionFactoryImpl.enableSSL(ConnectionFactoryImpl.java:211)
{code}

Thanks [~decker] , I uploaded the logs from the other machine in HA, to the escalation ticket. Hope those would help in finding out the root cause.

Please note that we are still facing this issue at this cloud and it is blocking customer to move this into Production at the moment.

If you have any questions please let [~graziano] know, as he would be following up on this with you.

Thanks [~graziano].

[~dshekhawat], [~graziano] and I confirmed the time line today and that the above cited issue was at the core of the problem.  The below commit contains the fix to the issue and it is in 3.2.1.

It does look like there was a subsequent issue which was not a cause of the problem, but I want to follow up because it looks like it may be buried in the JDK somewhere.

{code}
Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
      at sun.security.ssl.JsseJce.isEcAvailable(JsseJce.java:183)
{code}

May I ask what {{java -version}} shows?  There is a fairly recent JDK bug which sounds similar.  That fix was backported to java 6u30.

http://bugs.sun.com/bugdatabase/view_bug.do?bug_id=7043514

commit 0144b629bd2398c082a2ef5fc144231fcacb9ece
Author: chris grzegorczyk <grze@eucalyptus.com>
Date:   Fri Jan 11 02:38:53 2013 -0800

    Fix to EUCA-4722 prevent runtime exceptions from propagting out of rollbacks, can happen during a failover during bootstrap.

Hi [~decker],

Please see below

{code}
java -version
java version "1.6.0_24"
OpenJDK Runtime Environment (IcedTea6 1.11.5) (rhel-1.50.1.11.5.el6_3-x86_64)
OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM (build 20.0-b12, mixed mode)
{code}
Made a few attempt to reproduce with 3.4 and same setup and failed to reproduce.
